article: As a kid, I spent my summers with my grandparents in Texas. And every few summers, we d _ the caravan , a group of Airstream trailer owners who _ together around the U.S. and Canada I loved and worshipped my grandparents and I really looked _ to these travels. On one particular _ I was about 10 years old. I was rolling around in the backseat. My grandfather was _ . And my grandmother had the passenger seat. She smoked throughout these trips, and I hated the _ . At that age, I d take any excuse to make estimates and do minor _ At any rate, I decided to do the math for my _ . I estimated the number of cigarettes per days, estimated the number of _ per cigarette and so on. When I was satisfied that I d come up with a reasonable number, I poked my head into the _ of the car, tapped my grandmother _ the shoulder, and proudly proclaimed, At two minutes per puff, you"ve taken nine years off your _ ! Because the ad said, every puff of a cigarette takes some number of minutes _ smoker s life I expected to be applauded for my _ and arithmetic skills. That s not what happened _ , my grandmother burst into _ . I sat in the backseat and did not know what to do. My grandfather was a highly intelligent, _ man. He had never said a harsh word to me. He pulled _ onto the shoulder of the highway. He stopped and got out of the car, _ me, and after a bit of silence he gently and _ said, Jeff, one day you ll understand that it s harder to be kind than clever.
